result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R. Valdez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work/ full time school or a combination.

Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts.

No contact with the victims unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

SAFE program and follow up.

AODA and follow up.

DNA sample.

Probation Review Hearing 3/23/2018.

timeConds.notes: Serve 104 days, and I/S 60 days for rule violations.

supervisions.notes:
with huber for work/school/treatment or a combination.
Concurrent with: each other

Case called: 8:51 am
INCLUDES 15CF1075, 17CF1163, 17CM2113.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Zachary Glascock;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF1075:
Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment-Domestic Abuse-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Battery-Domestic Abuse-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Repeater)>>DRI.

17CF1136:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Possession of THC-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
15CF1075:
Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

17CF1136:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

17CM2113:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF1075:
Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, No Contact with the Victims unless approved by agent, Impose 164 Days MCJ, Serve 104 Days MCJ, and I/S 60 Days MCJ for Rule Violations, I/S 30 Hours of Community Service for rule violations, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 104 Days Credit.

17CF1136:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>  Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from  Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, No Contact with the Victims unless approved by agent, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 104 Days Credit. 

17CM2113:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, No Contact with the Victims unless approved by agent, Restitution in the amount of $44.90 to be paid, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.
